text.section: In this section, "Board" means the Board of Trustees of Blind Industries and Services of Maryland.
There is a Board of Trustees that is a body corporate under the name of "Blind Industries and Services of Maryland".

section.section: The Board consists of 11 trustees appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.
Of the 11 trustees, at least 4 trustees shall be blind.
From among its members, the Board shall elect a chair and a treasurer.
The Board may elect another member to serve as chair if it is inconvenient or impossible for the regularly elected chair to serve.
The term of a member is 3 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 2007.
The Governor shall fill a vacancy on the Board by appointment with the advice and consent of the Senate.
A member who is appointed after a term begins shall serve only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section:
A trustee is entitled to:
per diem compensation for each Board or committee meeting attended in accordance with the State budget; and
reimbursement for expenses incurred in the performance of the trustee's duties under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
The Board shall be audited annually.
